Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Inventory holds all the items and allows for functions pretaining to an item to be called
    Since:
    February 12, 2020

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory(java.util.ArrayList<Item> itemList)
      Constructor for the Inventory, however to have an inventory an itemList must exist

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Item> getItemList()
      Returns the ArrayList of Items
      void getItemQuantity()
      Checks the quantity for all items in inventory to see if their stock is less than 50, if it is creates an Order for them, and displays the Orderline
      Order getOrder()
      Gets the Order, which is to be used to write a text file of Order
      boolean manageItem(java.lang.String itemName)
      Decreases item quantity by 1 if the name of the item can be found in inventory.
      void printItems()
      Prints out all the items in Inventory and their information
      void printOrder()
      Prints the ORDER
      Item searchForItem(int itemID)
      Search for an item given its ID
      Item searchForItem(java.lang.String itemName)
      Search for an item given its name

      • manageItem

        public boolean manageItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Decreases item quantity by 1 if the name of the item can be found in inventory. If quantity is 0 or less, does not decrease, and orders more If the quantity is less than 50 creates an Order for the Item
        Parameters:
        itemName - Name of the item to decrease quantity of
        Returns:
        True if the item quantity was decrease, false otherwise

      • searchForItem

        public Item searchForItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Search for an item given its name
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item to search for
        Returns:
        an object of Item if found, else null

      • searchForItem

        public Item searchForItem(int itemID)
        Search for an item given its ID
        Parameters:
        itemID - the id of the item to search for
        Returns:
        an object of the Item if found, else null

      • getItemQuantity

        public void getItemQuantity()
        Checks the quantity for all items in inventory to see if their stock is less than 50, if it is creates an Order for them, and displays the Orderline

      • printItems

        public void printItems()
        Prints out all the items in Inventory and their information
